contentrichtext.text: [[Image:Indiancourt.jpg|thumb|150px|right|WPA Poster]] '''Federal Project Number One''' was the collective name for a group of projects under the [[Work Projects Administration]], a [[New Deal]] program in the [[United States]]. The five elements of the program were: :[[Federal Writers' Project]] (FWP) :[[Historical Records Survey]] (HRS, originally part of the FWP) :[[Federal Theatre Project]] (FTP) :[[Federal Music Project]] (FMP) :[[Federal Art Project]] (FAP) It was part of [[Franklin Delano Roosevelt]]'s Second New Deal, and was the largest of its projects. ==See also== {{commons|Category:Works Progress Administration}} *[[Mathematical Tables Project]] *[[Harry Hopkins]] ==External links== * [http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=Xa9Mjfr5foY Footage of the Federal Theatre Project's 1936 "Voodoo Macbeth"] - with informative annotations. *[http://www.archives.gov/exhibit_hall/new_deal_for_the_arts/index.html National Archives and Records Administration: A New Deal for the Arts] * [http://www.wwcd.org/policy/US/newdeal.html New Deal Cultural Programs: Experiments in Cultural Democracy] * [http://www.nps.gov/elro/glossary/federal-project-number1.htm Eleanor Roosevelt National Historic Site: Federal Project Number One] * [http://newdeal.feri.org/nation/na37145p067.htm McCausland, Elizabeth, "Save the Arts Projects," ''The Nation'', July 17, 1937]{{-}} {{Federal One}} [[Category:New Deal Projects of the arts]] [[Category:Works Progress Administration]] [[Category:Federal Art Project]] [[Category:New Deal agencies]] [[Category:Public art in the United States]] [[Category:Cultural history of the United States]] {{art-org-stub}} {{US-hist-stub}}
